pr_title: HDDS-3646. Add a copy command to copy key to a new one.

timeline.message: HDDS-3646. Add a copy command to copy key to a new one.
HDDS-3646. Add a copy command to copy key to a new one.

timeline.bodyText:
Redundant import statements.
Avoid using * and instead import the specific classes/members needed.
timeline.author: dineshchitlangia

timeline.bodyText: Can we rename the class to CopyKeyHandler ?
timeline.author: dineshchitlangia

timeline.bodyText:
Since we are assuming that the copy command is to copy a key in within the same bucket, this GDPR piece of code won't cause any problem.
Can we pls add comments in the javadoc to state the copy will only for copying keys within the same bucket?
This will be a safeguard for users attempting to doing something like:
ozone sh key cp /vol1/bucket1/key1 /vol1/bucket5/newkey
timeline.author: dineshchitlangia

timeline.bodyText: Why is the size hardcoded as 0 ?
timeline.author: dineshchitlangia

replies.bodyText: Sorry, i replace it to the input stream size.
replies.author: maobaolong

timeline.message: HDDS-3646. Address comments. Update javadoc, add test, fix style.

timeline.bodyText:
Your previous code was fine. The bucket metadata object may have properties that may not be needed for the key. So, if we copy the bucket metadata to be saved as key metadata, that is basically the piece of data which is mostly irrelevant for the key.
So you can replace bucket.getMetadata() with keyMetadata.
timeline.author: dineshchitlangia

timeline.message: HDDS-3646. Address comments. revert to the keyMetadata.

timeline.bodyText:
cp requires bucket URI and key names to be supplied separately:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                                Execute             ozone sh key cp ${protocol}${server}/${volume}/bb1/key1 ${protocol}${server}/${volume}/bb1/key1-copy
          
          
            
                                Execute             ozone sh key cp ${protocol}${server}/${volume}/bb1 key1 key1-copy
timeline.author: adoroszlai
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -114,6 +114,10 @@ Test key handling
                     Execute             rm -f /tmp/NOTICE.txt.1
                     Execute             ozone sh key get ${protocol}${server}/${volume}/bb1/key1 /tmp/NOTICE.txt.1
                     Execute             diff -q /opt/hadoop/NOTICE.txt /tmp/NOTICE.txt.1
+                    Execute             ozone sh key cp ${protocol}${server}/${volume}/bb1/key1 ${protocol}${server}/${volume}/bb1/key1-copy

timeline.message: HDDS-3646. Add the missed changed file to git

timeline.bodyText: One more thing: I think instead of building key metadata from scratch, cp should copy actual metadata of the existing key, which it can get via OzoneKeyDetails (except GDPR_SECRET and GDPR_ALGORITHM should be removed).  This would ensure that any user-supplied custom metadata is transferred, as well as reduce the need for future changes in case new default metadata is added in PutKeyHandler.
timeline.author: adoroszlai

replies.bodyText: Thank you for your advice, done.
replies.author: maobaolong
